result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John M Powless

records.addlTxt: No contact with: Victim D.E.S. or Co-defendant Ashley Kriederman.  Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

1:27 PM Defendant John M Powless appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dvoran appears in court, advises Defendant did not wish to speak with public defender.  Court reviews charges and potential penalties with the Defendant.  Court finds probable cause.  Court advises Defendant as to right to counsel.  Defendant indicates wishes to be represented by public defender.  Atty Dvoran advises Defendant will qualify for public defender.  State recommends $5,000 cash bail.  Counsel as to bail.  Court sets bail.  Court finds good cause to waive time limits for preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
